title: Trump Pardons Ex-Rep. Michael Grimm, Highlighting Political Clemency Campaign
summary: President Donald Trump pardoned former Republican Representative Michael Grimm, who served seven months in prison for tax fraud and resigned from Congress in 2015. The pardon was part of a broader clemency effort targeting individuals with felony convictions similar to legal challenges faced by Trump himself.
description: Trump issued a full pardon to Michael Grimm, a former New York congressman convicted of tax fraud and related charges. Grimm had previously served seven months in prison and a month of house arrest after pleading guilty in 2014 to aiding and assisting the preparation of a false tax return. His pardon comes amid a broader presidential clemency campaign that includes individuals with felony convictions analogous to Trump's own legal challenges.
